thread.title: 7th Open Source Backup Conference 2015 Started with a Major Release
thread.title_full: 7th Open Source Backup Conference 2015 Started with a Major Release - PR.com

author: PR.com
title: 7th Open Source Backup Conference 2015 Started with a Major Release
text:
7th Open Source Backup Conference 2015 Started with a Major Release
On September 29th and 30h, 2015, the Open Source Backup Conference on Bareos took place in Cologne. The organizers, NETWAYS and dass IT, could welcome 65 guests from Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Netherland and Germany.
Nuremberg, Germany, October 09, 2015 --( PR.com )-- The OSBConf takes place in the Rhine city every year since 2009. This year again, the leading conference on backup took place on two days. The specialist for open source events, NETWAYS Event Services GmbH, and the company dass IT were in charge of the organization.
After Maik Aussendorf welcomed all participants, he announced the availability of the next major Bareos release. The 15.2 release candidate has passed all regression and continuous integration tests on all supported platforms. More than 300k lines of code were modified since 14.2.2, including cleanup, redesign, bug fixes and many new features.
As one of the minds of the Bareos Project, Philipp Storz himself started the first talk “Backup of VMware snapshots with Bareos” together with Stephan Dühr, one of the persons mainly responsible for the development of the plugin.
Amongst others, Niels de Vos (Red Hat), Alberto Giménez (CAPSiDE), Marco Weiss (Kessler GmbH), Josef Weingand (IBM), Christoph Mitasch and Thomas Niedermeier (Thomas Krenn AG), Christian Theune (Flying Circus) as well as the managing director of Bareos, Maik Aussendorf, guaranteed an informative and interesting program.
In addition to the talks, workshops and hands-on trainings were offered on the first day of the event.
With 65 guests from six countries, the conference reached a new attendance record and the organizers have plans to expand internationally within the next years.
In 2016 the Open Source Backup Conference on Bareos will take place on September 26th and 27th in Cologne.
For press enquiries

About NETWAYS GmbH
NETWAYS GmbH has been supporting companies to manage complex IT infrastructures for more than 15 years.
Specializing in enterprise grade open source tools, NETWAYS ensures the smooth operation of networks, servers and applications. Solutions include availability and performance monitoring with Icinga and Nagios; service and configuration management; cluster and load balancing systems for open source data centers as well as hosting and managed services.
NETWAYS also organizes various conferences and training courses on open source monitoring and open source data center solutions.
For more information: www.netways.de
